1.title: Teacher’s toolbox
1.description: A collection of pedagogical scenarios for teachers for adapting and improving inquiry activities. Pedagogical instruments and tools for assessing the inquiry proficiency of pupils.

2.title: Inquiry activities
2.description: A growing collection of fun activities that illustrate how scientific inquiry works, how whole communities can be engaged in science and how to think about the bigger picture behind a simple experiment or research task.

3.title: Community
3.description: The Ark of Inquiry community – join a group created by your teacher, check out what are other groups in the area doing, join discussions on the group comments board or find out about other ways to communicate with your fellow inquirers.

4.title: My inquiry passport
4.description: Your inquiry passport is your calling card, it shows who you are and what types of activities you have completed and what kind of rewards you have collected during your stay in the Ark of Inquiry platform.

mainMenu.footerText:
„Ark of Inquiry: Inquiry Awards for Youth over Europe“ is a project on teacher training, oriented towards raising science awareness, particularly that of youth aged 7 to 18, to Responsible Research and Innovation, (RRI). It is a coordination and support action under FP7-SCIENCE-IN-SOCIETY-2013-1, ACTIVITY 5.2.2 Young people and science: Topic SiS.2013.2.2.1-1 Raising youth awareness to Responsible Research and Innovation through Inquiry Based Science Education. This project has received funding from the European Union’s Seventh Framework Programme for research, technological development and demonstration under grant agreement no 612252.
© 2016, Ark of Inquiry consortium. Special thanks to the team of Tallinn University for the development of the platform.

listPage.title: Inquiry activities
listPage.introText:
Here you can search and browse the collection of the inquiry activities. The collection features carefully selected inquiry activities that promote pupils’ RRI awareness. The activities have been collected from various national and international projects and have been tested by pupils and teachers all over Europe. The collection is growing, as new activities are being added here every day.
You can search the activities via search form or use the tag cloud. In the search form, you can filter the results according to different parameters, like domain, language, proficiency level, etc.

Be sure to check out our Hall of Fame page where we celebrate the best young scholars and scientists among us!

hallOfFamePage.introText:
In the Ark of Inquiry Project, an award system is designed to challenge and stimulate pupils to become responsible researchers and innovators. On this Hall of fame page we celebrate the success of our learners and make their accomplishments visible for all.
The award system consists of five awards: a star, diploma, bronze medal, silver medal, and a gold medal. The awards can be obtained cumulatively by individual learners. That means that in order to earn a gold medal, a pupil must obtain all other awards first. The awards a pupil obtained are published on the profile page and on this Hall of Fame page.
At stage 1 an inquiry star and diploma celebrate the ability to individually reflect on the relevance, consequences and ethics of processes and outcomes of inquiry for oneself, others and society. At stage 2 bronze, silver and gold medals celebrate excellent communication and discussion about the relevance, consequences and ethics of inquiry processes and outcomes for oneself, others and society with an audience.
Pupils can obtain up to all five awards during the time they participate in the Ark of Inquiry.
Together with their teachers pupils take active roles in getting nominated. Granting is organized by a national jury consisting of teachers, teacher educators and experts. The process of awarding is coordinated by a national administrator.
In addition to the awards, the Ark of Inquiry platform also features a set of OpenBadges. Badges can be obtained for completing a set of activities, for mastering a specific domain or just by showing initiative. Start collecting badges by starting your next inquiry activity!
hallOfFamePage.subHeading: Below are the learners who have been awarded inquiry awards by the Ark of Inquiry jury:
hallOfFamePage.goldText: Only 1% of all the learners will obtain a gold medal. In order to get a gold medal, learners will first have to obtain all other four awards. This award focusses on the attitude and ability to communicate and discuss processes and outcomes of inquiry with an audience. So let us celebrate our best inquirers and responsible researchers among us! Congratulations, dear gold medalists!
hallOfFamePage.silverText: Only 5% of all the learners will obtain a silver medal. In order to get a silver medal, learners will first have to obtain all other three awards. This award focusses on the attitude and ability to communicate and discuss processes and outcomes of inquiry with an audience. Congratulations, dear silver medalists!
hallOfFamePage.bronzeText: Only 10% of all the learners will obtain a bronze medal. In order to get a bronze medal, learners will first have to obtain all other three awards. This award focusses on the attitude and ability to communicate and discuss processes and outcomes of inquiry with an audience. Congratulations, dear bronze medalists!
hallOfFamePage.diplomasText: Diplomas focus on the development of the attitude and ability to individually reflect on inquiry activities. Diplomas are granted for endeavours that pupils undertake to individually think through the relevance, consequences and ethics of processes and outcomes of the inquiry activity for themselves, others and/or society in a reflective report. Congratulations, our distinguished scholars!
hallOfFamePage.starsText: Inquiry stars focus on the development of the attitude and ability to individually reflect on inquiry activities. Inquiry stars are granted for endeavours that pupils undertake to individually think through the relevance, consequences and ethics of processes and outcomes of the inquiry activity for themselves, others and/or society in a reflective report. Congratulations, our renowned scientists!
hallOfFamePage.noMedalistsText: No users have gained this badge yet.
